title: @Riot I know you probably don't care about Aram balance much but Dark harvest is really overpowered
body:
It's so little fun having my champion just be one shot from one ability half one shot from a tank rotation or poked by one Ezreal Q for a third of my health, this rune is just passively there and the longer the game goes the more oppressive it gets.

I really wish it could be replaced by electrocute or grayed out or something that stops 3-4 people from picking it and just smashing people with it with a sheen item ontop of it.  Every other rune takes interaction and knowing it's damage Dark harvest is just kinda like an Extra Sheen proc on abilities that scales, it's doing above average damage compared to other runes early to mid but mid to late this rune is doing often double the damage of others it's just overpowering every other rune from being taken (Even though the other runes intensives the ARAM fun mentality)

I'm fine with tanks being dominant or poke comps being annoying but this rune singlehandedly pushes me away from playing ARAM and i'll admit i used it early on but realized how little fun it was to play against and tried to let others enjoy the experiance rather than Jarvan and Ekko doing over half your hp in an auto.

Please Riot let ARAM have some more strategic picking of runes rather than everyone picking up dark harvest.

replies.body:
We had done the one nerf to DH on Aram back in...December I believe, and recall that it changed it reasonably. Does it still feel completely over bearing to you guys? See below for a graph that shows some of the relative performance of keystones from back in mid January when I pulled the data as followup, not entirely sure what it looks like now, but suspect it's similar. The red bars indicate number of plays with the keystone, and the winrate% is well...winrate. Tons of nuance here though since it's not broken out by champs that might abuse it more (Ezreal, J4, Ekko as you mention).

https://i.imgur.com/hdx7ii1.png

I sincerely believe something needs to be done about Ezreal in general.

He has a long history of breaking stuff in the game, getting it nerfed, and forcing it out eventually, and I think some minor work could be done to prevent him from doing that in the future.

That being said, Dark Harvest could use some fine tuning for ARAM.

Dark Harvest still very much feels overbearing. Presumably DH is meant to be the late-game scaling rune, but it's scaling far too quickly. From checking scoreboard damage totals, DH is often only slightly weaker compared to other damage-oriented runes (e.g. electrocute, PtA, comet) in the early-game, but outperforms them by mid-game.

If those graphs span the entire MMR range, knowledge flow might be a factor. Players who aren't as familiar with ARAM might simply be porting their builds from other game modes, where DH isn't much of a problem. Furthermore, DH is the keystone of choice for bruisers and assassins, classes which are typically average at best in ARAM.
I just want to mention how last 4 fiddlestick changes, Literaly last 4 changes he received** all buffed his aram **

It can get out of hand in really bloody games, but it's just kind of strong in your average game imo. It certainly crowds out the other domination keystones. Hec might be the only one who should take Predator and combo mages are probably the only ones who should take Electrocute.

I don't think Predator is viable on Hecarim in aram. Sure it has synergy with his kit, but it's also. up ***way***. less often.

The biggest problem with Dark Harvest is the sheer fact that you can pop it several times in the same fight, every fight.

Yeah, that’s what I meant about bloody games. You get more stacks and deal a lot of damage. Some fights are much more drawn out (particularly if supports and tanks are involved) in which case some classes suffer from not taking a standard keystone like PTA.

Predator Hec is kind of cheesy but it can work. He can go a ms/burst build and literally one-shot squishies much quite a bit sooner than he could with DH.

Yes it is overbearing. I play at 2600 mmr and it's taken by most marksmen, bruisers, tanks, and even some mages. IMO you should just disable this rune for aram and replace it with Electrocute.  This wouldn't take much effort and will fix the issue. I don't want a special rune that is only viable in my game mode, but I have to take it because it's so OP.  There's a bunch of other intersting  keystones that I'd rather take for fun.  Dying is too punishing and giving away Dark Harvest stacks is part ot that problem. Part of the reason lane dominant champions are so strong is DH, the other being Triumph.

Well last time I played aram this week a dark harvest tahm kench single-handedly kept us in a game we should have lost at 15 minutes, dealing more than 7k damage with the rune over the course of the game. Didn't feel exactly balanced.

2 things imo to consider:

1. like all damage spells, Dark Harvest tends to look and feel better than it actually is, its power tends to be very visible and well communicated "wow you did a lot of damage!", whereas less shiny keystones and more defensive ones can be more difficult to appreciate "wow, you took less damage, kinda? I guess? maybe?" it's a natural cognitive bias and it's always going to be like that, ex: auras, the support role etc.

2. like you said, Dark Harvest tends to be good on champions that are underperforming, most melee-ish damage dealers, assassins and some juggernauts. the only champion in the top 30 who makes any use of this Keystone is Miss Fortune, everyone else is better off using something else.

imo, you shouldn't make any more change, it has a healthy place in the ecosystem, it makes bad champions better, not great still, but better, and reduces the gap between said bad champions and the better ones, any attempt at further balancing this keystone and is going to make the game less balanced as a result.

edit: do you have data for games length? say last month vs 1 year ago? and dark harvest win rate over time? it's also possible Dark Harvest power might get darwfed a bit there and the games are noticeably shorter than they used to be and Dark Harvest becomes more oppressive the longer the games last

The one thing you have not considered is that ARAM is all about team fighting. This is where the keystone is abused. You kill a target, your team picks up the dark harvest and one shot another champion and so on. The fact that it drops from cannon minions, Allies death, Enemies death, and scales so well is what makes it anti fun and unhealthy. The other keystones are either active every x seconds or don't scale as much. 


Dark Harvest:

1. Gathered with Enemy Death , Ally Death, Cannon minion 
2. Dominates team fights which is what ARAM is about (yes you can have your poke comps which can still abuse dark harvest)
3. There is no Time limit on "use." kill a champion, pick their dark harvest, attack the next and so on. 
4. Makes Tanks deal more "significant" damge while solely building tank items. 
5. Scales really fast. Its easy to get given how narrow ARAM is and everyone is  in the same place. 
6.   I want diversity. If you are not seeing people picking this up in ARAM then your mmr is not high. I am not shaming anyone. If you are playing vs Diamonds you will know what I am talking about.


I would suggest making DH damage half if used within the next 10-15 seconds? It deals full damage afterwards? Or nerf scaling? I am open to ideas.

I know how the keystone works and yes you could be led to believe it could be really good in aram but 1) it already got specifically nerfed in aram and isn't that good anymore, even in aram (as you can see with the above charts Riot provided, or the charts from lolalytics) and 2) the champions that make the best use of this keystone aren't good in aram, assassins, melee fighters, juggernauts aren't good, they are either really bad, or mediocre and other champions, including all the top tiers champions have better keystones to use. Changing this keystone further isn't going to balance aram more as a whole, it's going to accomplish the opposite, it's going to increase the discrepancy between good and bad champions more than it already is.

Last I checked, my aram mmr was around 2800 tho, I'm kind of a bit experienced with aram, I've been around for a long time haha

I tried to look you up but you are only playing bots so cannot actually confirm your ARAM mmr, but if its 2800 that's very awesome dude! 

Back to the discussion: I don't know how you are not seeing DH as a problem. They specifically nerfed DH for ARAM, correct. Was this enough, no it was not. DH still scales insanely well into mid/late game. It still does more damage than any other keystone in ARAM. For Champions that make use of it, anyone can and it will work. I have even built this on Lux, sona, etc. 


"Changing this keystone further isn't going to balance aram more as a whole, it's going to accomplish the opposite, it's going to increase the discrepancy between good and bad champions more than it already is."

I disagree. It's diverting champions from picking up relevant keystones with a few exceptions like Jihn. The main issue with ARAM is its not a fair"all random all mid." People have different champion pools and some even go to the extend of building ARAM accounts. This is the main issue with champion diversity that also increases the discrepancy between good and bad champions. DH is not the solution. If I am seeing 7 players picking up DH while 3 other picking something else then this does nothing except killing the diversity if any.

If you are picking Dark Harvest on champions like Lux or Sona, you are doing it wrong, they have better keystones and better runes to use. That's what I'm saying, it may sound like a good idea, but if you check a data website like lolalytics, you'll see that tanks, supports, mages, most marksmen etc are doing better on average with keystones like Aftershock, Summon Aery, Arcane Comet and Fleet Footwork respectively.

So if you nerf it, the only champions who take a hit are the champions for whom DH is the best keystone, and those champions aren't tanks or mages or adcs but melee assassins, fighters and juggernauts for the most part.
I am saying it will work not that I would take it. This is how Dark Harvest is broken.  We can't use a broken keystone to try to balance ARAM. It's not a good idea.

You can play Aftershock Lux too and it will work, what's your point, it's still not good, should we nerf it too? How is Arcane Comet on Lux less broken than Aftershock or Dark Harvest? It's her best keystone, if Aftershock and Dark Harvest are broken, then Arcane Comet is super duper broken. Your reasoning makes no sense, you nerf what's good and buff what isn't good, not the opposite.

Did you really just compare DH on Lux to Aftershock? Do you think I would walk to a melee range as Lux to proc After shock? DH procs on your max Auto Range. Have you even compared DH damage in ARAM to Arcane Comet? Do you know that Aftershock and Arcane Comet have CDR while DH does not have any CDR in terms of how many times you can pick it up and proc its damage? 

Also, no offense but your last ARAM game is 9/15/2017. This is over 5 months. Are you still up to date with the game? Have you actually played any ARAM games recently?. I would love for you to teach me ARAM if you your MMR is 2800 and not using an ARAM account.

not sure if you caught the 2nd paragraph, I edited my post.

> We currently have a good selection of equally powerful keystones to pick from depending on which champion you play, some that are popular like Aftershock, Guardian, Arcane Comet, Summon Aery, Dark Harvest, Electrocute, Fleet Footwork and some are less popular or very specific like Phase Rush or Grasp of the Undying, all of them are very good, why would you want to remove one option if it's on par with other options?

don't remember the last time I played ARAM, but I played a lot of Poro King (ARAM with a twist) and Ascension and other stuff recently here and on the PBE, which are just as bloody. yes Dark Harvest is very good in those game modes, because people die a lot but the other keystones I mentioned above are also very good, it simply depends on the champions you play. I believe the 'fighters' pool has the most champions of any other classes, that may explain why you see it more often than some other keystones, it's also a generalist keystone which means it should have a wider audience of champions that can pick it up, but the more specialised keystones are often better on all those champions, Aftershock may not be great on mages or adcs or assassins but it's very good on tanks, Fleet Footwork may not be great on tanks or mages or assassins, but it's very good on ADCs. etc. Having a keystone that is mediocre on a lot of champions is not an issue.

However, other game modes are not ARAM. Poro King is not ARAM.  How am I supposed to take your opinion into consideration when you have 0 ARAM games played in over 5 months? 

You cannot see how DH is busted if you have not played this mode in 5 months. That's my argument right now. I am a Diamond Support last season. I would not call myself Diamond right now till I hit Diamond in S8. This is my simple argument regardless of how you think about ARAM and DH.

Play 30 or so ARAM games then we can talk about balancing ARAM. If all you do is play bots and other game mode and then you want to have a fair and constructive argument about Dark Harvest in ARAM then I am sorry.  I cannot take your opinion seriously

1. yes I've played the game with the new runes and more, just not the past 2 months

2. again, it's not an opinion, opinions have no weight, nobody cares what x or y thinks, it's always subjective and anecdotal, the truth is what matters, and you get to know the truth looking at facts and other objective sources of information, like statistics, said statistics that are accessible for everyone to see, go look for yourself, https://lolalytics.com/aram/worldwide/platinum/plus/champions/ , spend some time looking at every champion page, what they pick, what they are most successful with etc, (it's something you should already be doing if you wanted to get better at the game tbh especially in aram where you are expected to be good on a wide variety of champions you are not very familiar with) you'll see dark harvest is just another keystone, with some pros and cons and champions it's good on and champions it's bad on.

Again, actually play ARAM on your account and show your mmr then we can talk.  I am not wasting my time trying to have a constructive argument with you if you refuse to  stay current to the meta.

From my experience, the problems are
1) A well-organized team, aka premade, can leverage the DH and snowball really hard. For example, in one of my games, I lost a team fight and our team got aced, and the enemy team took 3 of our towers because enemy team has 4 DH (2 of them are ADCs, the other 1 is Camille) and DH works on structures. I think it's so stupid that losing 1 teamfight costs the entire game, and it's not even in late game (the game ends in 16 min).
2) Tanks can abuse DH as well, specifically tanks with dash skills or with heal mechanics, and I think many people have already explained it very well. Like, 2+ tanks and some form of waveclear can just ensure them to turtle under the tower and stack DH. And when it's in like 20+ min, boom, the team with more tanks win. Even if the other team has ADC, they will still struggle – if the ADC made one single mistake, they will be hit so hard by the enemy tank with snowball and DH and will be not able to lifesteal the damage back because of the DH burst or even overkill.

Sorry for the late response but yes i would really enjoy it being toned down there really isn't much you can do when people can just stall out games with it and it really doesn't provide many opportunities for outplays either.

It's just not a fun rune in general, it leaves an unsatisfying feeling at least you have the illusion of being able to outplay electrocute or meteor as they come out as you're being hit by things and can be avoided Dark harvest is so frontloaded and there isn't any chance to miss it.

PTA, Arey, Spell Book, and Glacial are very good keystones as well.

Are you a tank? -> Aftershock
Are you a mage? -> Meteor
Are you ranged? -> Dark Harvest / Footwork
Can you cheese Dark Harvest with a gapcloser?  -> Dark Harvest
None of the above? -> Reroll
No rerolls left? -> Dodge

Tbh even a lot of Comet and Footwork users should opt into Dark Harvest, though Aftershock is more iffy. Even if you don't want to be anywhere near the other team they definitely want to get close and personal with you at times x)
